text:
Hanover Sq. & William St.
The Cȯlton Exchange
American Photo Service Inc.
No date.

No. 1 Hanover Square, south side, between Stone (right) and Pearl (left) Streets, showing the 3-story India House. Also shown (left) is a portion of the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Line.

About 1923.

Gift of E. M. Jenks.
title: Manhattan: Hanover Square - Stone Street

text:
(1) No. 1 Hanover Square, south side, between Stone (right), to Pearl (left) streets, showing the India House. Also shown is Stone Street, west side, south from Hanover Square to Mill Lane, with the Maritime Agency building (part of which is shown), at the S.W. corner of Stone Street. Adjoining the same, is the 4-story building of Chubb & Son at the N.W. corner of Mill Lane. August 21, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a Municipal Comfort Station in the center of the Square. On the left appears the South Ferry Division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Lines, running at this point on Pearl Street. neg. B-62 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, showing overhead a navy dirigible. July 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Stone and William Streets, Manhattan

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code I C
May 12, 1936

No. 1 Hanover Square, south side, between Stone and Pearl Street's, showing the entrance to the India House.

November, 1939

Gift of Beecher Ogden
title: Manhattan: Hanover Square - Stone Street
